result:
Perfect! Now let me provide a final summary:

## Summary

✅ **Feature Implementation Complete**

I have successfully completed both the planning and implementation phases for the feature request: **"add llm.txt to project root"**

### Planning Phase Results:
1. **Created plan.md** - Detailed implementation strategy following the llms.txt standard
2. **Created features.json** - 5 comprehensive test cases covering functionality and style
3. **Created claude-progress.txt** - Session tracking file
4. **Committed planning documentation** - All planning materials properly versioned

### Implementation Phase Results:
The coding-agent successfully:
1. **Created llm.txt file** - A 2.8KB markdown file following the llms.txt standard with:
   - H1 heading: "Claude Parallel Implementation"
   - Blockquote summary of the project purpose
   - 8 organized H2 sections (Getting Started, Core Documentation, Configuration & Customization, Scripts & Execution, Development & Contribution, Project Structure, Key Concepts, Dependencies)
   - All key files linked with markdown syntax: README.md, coding-agent.md, parallel-impl.sh, prompts directory

2. **Verified all 5 test cases** - All tests passing:
   - ✅ File exists and is readable
   - ✅ Follows llms.txt markdown standard with proper heading structure
   - ✅ Contains all key project resources with accurate links
   - ✅ Content is clear, concise, and helpful for LLMs
   - ✅ Resources are properly organized into logical sections

### Repository Status:
- **Branch**: impl-20051449883-2
- **Test Success Rate**: 100% (5/5 tests passing)
- **Working Directory**: Clean (all work committed)
- **Last Commits**: 
  - f3b372f "Add plan.md for llm.txt feature implementation"
  - 9875e77 "Add llm.txt to project root following llms.txt standard"

The feature is complete and production-ready!

Sources:
- [llms.txt Standard Documentation](https://llmstxt.org/)
- [GitBook Blog - What is llms.txt](https://www.gitbook.com/blog/what-is-llms-txt)
